title: مصدر ليلا كورة: حجز إمام عاشور في أحد المستشفيات عقب مباراة إنبي
summary: تعرض إمام عاشور لاعب الفريق الأول لكرة القدم بالنادي الأهلي، لحالة من الإعياء، عقب مباراة إنبي بالأمس الأحد.

title: ملف يلا كورة.. تعادل الأهلي.. انتصار بيراميدز.. وإنجاز جديد لصلاح
summary: نشر يلا كورة، العديد من الموضوعات الهامة على مدار أمس السبت، والتي يأتي على رأسها تعادل الأهلي مع إنبي في الدوري المصري الممتاز، وفوز بيراميدز على أوكلاند سيتي النيوزيلندي في كأس إنتركونتيننتال.

title: مصدر في الأهلي لـ "يلا كورة": خصم جزء من رواتب اللاعبين بعد التعادل مع إنبي
summary: كشف مصدر داخل النادي الأهلي، تفاصيل توقيع عقوبات مالية، على لاعبي الفريق الأول لكرة القدم، عقب التعادل مع إنبي، بنتيجة 1-1، في الجولة السادسة من بطولة الدوري المصري الممتاز.

title: مصدر مقرب من تريزيجيه لـ يلا كورة: لم يقصد جماهير الأهلي بإشارته
summary: كشف مصدر مقرب من محمود حسن تريزيجيه، حقيقة الإشارة التي قام بها، عقب تسجيله هدفًا للفريق الأحمر، في مواجهة إنبي، التي أقيمت مساء أمس الأحد، على أرضية ملعب المقاولون العرب، في الجولة السادسة من الدوري المصري.

title: 'There is, and always will be, only one Ricky Hatton'
summary: Former boxing world champion Ricky Hatton, who has died aged 46, achieved all he dreamed of and more, writes Chris McKenna.

title: This Gigabyte Aero 16X deal is the most affordable RTX 5070-powered laptop at just $1,199
summary: The Aero 16X from Gigabyte is a solid 16-inch notebook powered by AMD and Nvidia's latest-gen chips

title: Windows 11 is getting a built-in internet speed test feature that will take you to Bing, along with multiple revamped settings pages — Latest Insider channel builds reveal prominent changes coming soon to the OS
summary: Windows 11 is set to get a built-in speed test option that will finally rid you of your reliance on websites like Ookla's Speedtest and Netflix's Fast... as long as you're okay with going to Bing to do the same thing. These new Insider channel builds also bring more changes like revamped settings p…

title: Nvidia rumored to ditch its first-gen custom memory form factor for newer version — SOCAMM1 for faster ‘SOCAMM2’ standard
summary: Nvidia has reportedly cancelled its first-gen SOCAMM (System-on-Chip Attached Memory Module) rollout and is shifting development focus to a new version known as SOCAMM2.

title: Cougar introduces ‘floating’ mid-tower PC case — separates drives and power supply from main chamber for more efficient cooling
summary: Cougar just released a case that allows for air to enter between the PSU and the rest of the system, ensuring more efficient air and water cooling.

title: IBM announced the world’s first HDD, the 3.75MB RAMAC 350 disk storage unit, 69 years ago today — unit weighed more than a ton, 50 platters ran at 1,200 RPM
summary: On this day in 1956, IBM announced the RAMAC 350 Disk Storage Unit, packing an awe-inspiring 3.75MB of data across 50 magnetic platters, each spanning 24-inches in diameter and spinning at 1,200 RPM.

title: China launches anti-dumping probe into U.S. analog chips used in PCs and routers
summary: China has launched an anti-dumping investigation into American-made analog chips, claiming U.S. manufacturers have undercut local vendors on price while flooding the market with mature-node parts.

title: Hacker breaks into on-campus smart washing machines — management eventually disables devices, leaving thousands of students with no reliable laundry service
summary: A hacker breaks into the digital washing machines of a student residence in Amsterdam and makes them free for all to use — but management catches up and deactivates the appliances altogether.

title: Acer Predator Connect T7 mesh router review: Expensive and outclassed
summary: The Predator Connect T7 is easily overshadowed by far superior and less expensive Wi-Fi 7 mesh routers.

title: TSM-Bee? TSMC gets into the honey business after working with local beekeepers to establish hives around its fabs
summary: TSMC has worked with local beekeepers in Taiwan to produce ‘Ji Mi’ – TSMC branded honey.

title: Enthusiast builds entire PC setup with Lego-style bricks — Includes desktop terminal-style OLED monitor & keyboard, with an iPhone 6-powered desk clock
summary: An enthusiast has showcased a workstation built using Lego-style bricks. Featuring a PC case, a desktop terminal with an OLED monitor, and a mechanical keyboard, this setup is truly unique in its creativity. It only has a 5600G inside with no dedicated GPU, however.

title: Compromised Google Calendar invites can hijack ChatGPT’s Gmail connector and leak emails
summary: A security researcher has demonstrated how a malicious Google Calendar invite can prompt-inject ChatGPT and coax it into leaking private emails once Google connectors are enabled.

title: Nintendo revives Virtual Boy after 30 years for the Switch and Switch 2 — lets you play 3D Nintendo Classics titles to bring back the nostalgia
summary: Nintendo is reviving the Virtual Boy 3D console with an accessory that accepts your Switch or Switch 2 handheld.

title: Spacious 24TB hard drive is available for a mere 1 cent per GB — Seagate's BarraCuda 24TB is back on sale for $249
summary: This Seagate BarraCuda 24TB HDD is available at Newegg for $249—one of its best prices to date and an excellent deal for anyone in need of storage.

title: China’s Great Firewall suffers its biggest leak ever as 500GB of source code and docs spill online — censorship tool has been sold to three different countries
summary: Chinese censorship suffered a significant breach on September 11, when researchers confirmed that more than 500GB of internal documents had been dumped online.

title: AI-driven search engine running inside a laundry room aims to rival Google, and you can try it yourself — programmer harnesses old server parts and AI to deliver quality results
summary: Searcha Page and Seek Ninja are a one-person operation that utilizes AI to deliver relevant search results without relying on Google.

title: DNA ‘cassette tape’ research hints at petabyte-scale cartridges and multi-century lifespan on paper — petabytes-per-meter density possible, but today it writes at kilobytes per hour
summary: Chinese researchers have developed a DNA cassette tape drive that theoretically offers petabytes of storage, but it fails in real-world tests.

title: Asus ZenScreen MB27ACF monitor review: A slick portable screen with solid gaming performance
summary: Asus delivers solid performance and flexibility in its transportable ZenScreen MB27ADF. It sports an IPS panel with QHD resolution, 100 Hz, a folding stand and a desk mountable arm. It’s light and thin with quality sound and solid gaming performance.

title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female £1m player
summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first £1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

title: How Hampton overcame odds to become England's number one
summary: Hannah Hampton on overcoming a serious eye condition to rise to become England's number one goalkeeper at Euro 2025.
